element.name: CreationDateTime
element.desc: The date and time of this attendance record was created.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: The role of the staff member for that created this attendance record.

element.name: UserId
element.desc: Unique identifier of the user that created the attendance record. This will depend on the user and the source. The preferred identifier would be a RefId for a StaffPersonal, StudentContact, or StudentPersonal Object. However, the user may not be associated with any of these SIF objects. In that case a unique ID given by the source should be used.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: The type of information that is contained in the DetailedDescription element.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: A GUID that identifies GradingAssignment.

attribute.name: SectionInfoRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID for the SectionInfo object.

attribute.name: TermInfoRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID for the TermInfo object that defines the marking period that the assignment was created in.

attribute.name: SchoolInfoRefId
attribute.desc: The ID (GUID) that uniquely identifies the School that these Mark Values apply to.

attribute.name: GradingCategoryRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID for the GradingCategory that this assignment is part of.

element.name: Description
element.desc: The text-based description of the assignment.

element.name: PointsPossible
element.desc: The points possible on the assignment.

element.name: CreateDate
element.desc: Creation date of the assignment.

element.name: DueDate
element.desc: Date the assignment is due.

element.name: Weight
element.desc: The weight of the assignment.

element.name: DetailedDescription
element.desc: This element defines the assignment. If the Type attribute is URL, this is the location of the document that describes the assignment. If Type is PDF, this element will contain the Base64 encoding of the entire document.

attribute.name: SchoolInfoRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that specifies the school this score was recorded at.

element.name: ScorePoints
element.desc: The score represented as points. Conditionally required that one or more of ScorePoints, ScorePercent or ScoreLetter must be filled in.

element.name: ScorePercent
element.desc: The score represented as a percent. Conditionally required that one or more of ScorePoints, ScorePercent or ScoreLetter must be filled in.

element.name: ScoreLetter
element.desc: The score represented as a letter grade. Conditionally required that one or more of ScorePoints, ScorePercent or ScoreLetter must be filled in.

element.name: ScoreDescription
element.desc: Text description of the score.

attribute.desc: The GUID for the TermInfo object that defines the marking period that the category was created in.

element.name: Description
element.desc: The name/short description of the category.

element.name: Percentage
element.desc: The percent score for this mark (0.00 - 100.00)

element.name: Numeric
element.desc: The raw numeric score for this mark.

element.name: Letter
element.desc: The letter grade for this mark.

element.name: Narrative
element.desc: The free form text narrative for this mark.

attribute.name: SIF_Action
attribute.desc: In a Change event, this flag can be used to indicate an element has been deleted from the parent list container. At a minimum the key for the list must also be present.

attribute.desc: The ID (GUID) that uniquely identifies the School that these Mark Values apply to.

element.name: SchoolYear
element.desc: The year that this MarkValueInfo applies to.

element.name: Name
element.desc: The text name of the value list ("Letter Grades", "Letter Grades (+/-)", "ESU", "Pass/Fail", "Override Grades", "Citizenship Comment Codes", etc.).

object.name: Narrative
object.desc: If present, indicates that a free-form text narrative is accepted.

attribute.desc: Indicates whether a narrative is accepted and is used in Change events to unambiguously signal whether support for the Mark has changed, especially ended.

element.name: MaximumSize
element.desc: An integer value representing the maximum number of Unicode characters for the narrative, the UTF-8 encoding of which may be longer.

element.name: Precision

element.name: Low

element.name: High
